info.title: Clients
info.description: Unified OpenAPI specification for clients domain

get.description:
## Overview
Retrieves a paginated list of clients for the business. Supports searching by various attributes and filtering by update timestamp.

## Authentication
**Available for Staff, App, and Directory Tokens.**

## When to Use
- Listing all clients for a business
- Searching for clients by email, phone, or UID
- Syncing clients modified after a specific date
- Building client selection interfaces

parameters.description: Specify the updated_at filter range, available operators for updated_at: gte, lte. example: updated_at[gte]=2019-01-01
parameters.name: updated_at

parameters.description: How many items to return per page. Default: 25. Max: 100
parameters.name: per_page

200.description: Success - Returns list of clients matching the search criteria

429.description: Too Many Requests - Rate limit exceeded for this business

post.description:
## Overview
Creates a new client record for the business. If a client with the same email already exists, returns a 409 Conflict error.

## Authentication
**Available for Staff, App, and Directory Tokens.**

## When to Use
- Adding new clients to your CRM
- Client registration from external systems
- Creating clients from lead capture forms

email.description: Email Address. Must be a valid email format (e.g., user@example.com)

opt_in_transactional_sms.description: Whether the client opts in to receive transactional SMS messages.

status.description: Use a client status to categorize clients according to their relationship with your business. Valid values: lead, customer, loyal, inactive

tags.description: The tag system is based on customized labels that you create, so you can sort your data using personalized words, phrases or themes that are meaningful to you and your business

put.description:
## Overview
Merge two or more duplicate clients into one primary client.

## Authentication
**Available for Staff, App, and Directory tokens.**

## Query Parameters
- `to_client_uid` (required): UID of the destination primary client
- `from_client_uids` (required): Comma-separated UIDs of clients to merge into the primary client

## Business Rules
- Clients must represent different contact persons to be merged
- Clients related to the same contact cannot be merged (returns 422 error)
- Use `GET /platform/v1/clients/merges/possible_merge_master` to check merge eligibility first

## Request Body
The request body can be empty but must be sent (e.g., `{}`).

parameters.description: UID of the destination primary client.
parameters.name: to_client_uid

parameters.description: UIDs of all the clients to be merged into the to_client_uid, comma separated
parameters.name: from_client_uids

put.summary: Merge duplicate clients into a primary client.

schema.description: The request body. It can be empty but must still be sent.

get.description:
## Overview
Returns a list of client UIDs that can be used as a primary client for the merge.

## Authentication
**Available for Staff, App, and Directory Tokens.**

## Required Parameters
- `client_ids` (required): Comma-separated client UIDs to check for merge eligibility.

## Business Rules
- **Clients with multiple matters cannot be merged** - If any selected client has more than one matter/project, the merge is not allowed
- Returns 422 if multiple clients are related to the same contact (e.g., pets belonging to the same owner)
- Clients must be independent contacts to be eligible for merge
- The error message format is: '{Term} cannot be merged since you selected more than 1 {term} related to the same contact'

## When to Use
- Checking which clients can be merged before calling the merge endpoint
- Building merge candidate selection UI
- Validating merge eligibility

parameters.description: List of client uids, comma separated
parameters.name: client_ids

get.summary: List of clients that can be used as primary for merge.

post.description:
## Overview
Update client package payment status (use a package credit).

## Authentication
**Available for Client Tokens only.**

## Note
There is also a Staff-facing version at `/platform/v1/payment/client_packages/update_usage` that accepts **Staff, App, and Directory tokens**.

## Prerequisites
The client must have active packages with available sessions for the service referenced in the `payment_status_id`. Returns 422 "There is no package to use" if no suitable packages exist.

## When to Use

- Checking if client has available package credits

put.description:
## Overview
Update a Client Available for **Staff, App, and Directory tokens**.

address.description: Address. Send `null` or `""` to clear this field if force_nullifying is true.

created_at.description: Client creation date. Read-only - automatically managed by the system and ignored in updates.

email.description: Email Address. Must be a valid email format (e.g., user@example.com)

force_nullifying.description: If true, allows nullable fields (address, mobile_phone) to be cleared by sending `null` or empty string. Must be boolean true or string "true".

mobile_phone.description: Phone Number. Send `null` or `""` to clear this field if force_nullifying is true.

status.description: Use a client status to categorize clients according to their relationship with your business. Valid values: lead, customer, loyal, inactive

tags.description: The tag system is based on customized labels that you create, so you can sort your data using personalized words, phrases or themes that are meaningful to you and your business

updated_at.description: Client last update date. Read-only - automatically managed by the system and ignored in updates.

get.description:
## Overview
Get External Connected Payment Application.

## Authentication
**Available for Client Tokens only.**

## Prerequisites
Requires a payment application (app_type=payments) to be installed and **fully connected** for the business. Returns 422 if no connected payment app exists.

### What "Fully Connected" Means
A payment app is considered fully connected when:
1. The app is assigned to the business via `POST /v3/apps/app_assignments`
2. The business has `external_[app_name]_connected=true` flag set
3. The app is not in pending/setup mode
4. For vcitaPayments: Terms and conditions must be accepted

## When to Use
- Getting the primary payment provider for checkout flows
- Checking if payment processing is available

description.text: This is a very long text that describes everything about the app

errors.message: To store cards on file connect to a credit card processor

get.description:
## Overview
Get the checkout session of a given payment request.

## Authentication
**No authentication token required.** This endpoint is designed for client checkout flows and skips token verification.

## Coupon Functionality
The optional `coupon_code` parameter applies a discount to the payment request. **Note:** Business must have `rollout.payments.coupons_checkout_v2` feature enabled and active coupons available. Returns 422 error if business is not eligible for coupon functionality.

## When to Use
- Client checkout flows
- Viewing payment request details
- Applying coupon discounts

parameters.description: Optional coupon code to apply discount to the payment request
parameters.name: coupon_code

## Overview
Submits Share Documents Form to the business.

**Available for Client Tokens only.**

This endpoint requires `multipart/form-data` format with actual binary file uploads (not JSON). Documents must be uploaded as form fields with proper content types.

post.description:
## Overview
Import clients to an app. Creates client records based on the provided field mappings.

## Authentication
**Available for Staff, App, and Directory tokens.**

## Prerequisites
1. The app specified by `app_code_name` must be assigned to the business
2. The app must have `app_type` set to `import_clients`
3. Use `POST /v3/apps/app_assignments` with `assignment_mode: 'internal'` to assign the app

## Request Body
- `import_params`: Configuration for the import process
- `fields_mapping`: Maps client fields to their values

send_notifications_when_done.description: Sends an email to staff when the import is done. Defaults to true. Set to false to skip.

upload_type.description: Is it single (individual contacts) or multi (multiple clients under the same contact)

**Available for Staff Tokens.**

- Building matter list views

post.description:
## Overview
Create a new Matter.

**Available for Staff tokens**

fields.description: A list of fields to be updated

value.description: The fields value to be updated

note.description: A note to add to the matter created

tags.description: Tags to add to the matter created

get.description:
## Overview
Gets Matters by filter. Searchable fields are: Email, First name, Last name, Matter name and Phone.

## When to Use
- Building list views and tables
- Searching for specific records
- Syncing data with external systems

## Required Parameters
You must provide a `filter` parameter to search. Without it, the endpoint returns HTTP 422.

## Filter Formats
- `filter[advanced][start_with]=term` - Search by name/email/phone prefix
- `filter[uid_in]=uid1,uid2,uid3` - Get specific matters by UIDs

**Available for Staff Tokens**

parameters.description: Filter query to search matters. Required. Examples: `filter[advanced][start_with]=john` (search by name/email/phone prefix), `filter[uid_in]=uid1,uid2` (get specific UIDs)
parameters.name: filter

- Building matter detail pages

put.description:
## Overview
Updates a Matter.

## Authentication
**Available for Staff, App, and Directory tokens.**

## Validation
- `uid` (path parameter): Must be a valid matter UID that exists and is accessible to the authenticated user
- `fields[].uid`: Each field UID must be a valid field that exists for this specific matter. Use `GET /business/clients/v1/matters/{uid}` to see available field UIDs.

parameters.description: Matter UID. Must be a valid matter UID that exists and is accessible to the authenticated user.
parameters.name: uid

fields.description: A list of fields to be updated. Each field UID must exist for this specific matter.

uid.description: The field UID. Must be a valid field that exists for this specific matter.

value.description: The field value to be updated
